name: DenoiseImage
author: ANTs Developers
description: Denoise an image using a spatially adaptive filter originally described in J. V. Manjon, P. Coupe, Luis Marti-Bonmati, D. L. Collins, and M. Robles. Adaptive Non-Local Means Denoising of MR Images With Spatially Varying Noise Levels, Journal of Magnetic Resonance Imaging, 31:192-203, June 2010.

inputs.name: Image dimensionality
inputs.description: -d, --image-dimensionality 2/3/4. This option forces the image to be treated as a specified-dimensional image. If not specified, the program tries to infer the dimensionality from the input image.

inputs.name: Noise model
inputs.description: -n, --noise-model Rician/(Gaussian). Employ a Rician or Gaussian noise model.

inputs.name: Shrink factor
inputs.description: -s, --shrink-factor (1)/2/3/... Running noise correction on large images can be time consuming. To lessen computation time, the input image can be resampled. The shrink factor, specified as a single integer, describes this resampling. Shrink factor = 1 is the default.

inputs.name: Mask image
inputs.description: -x, --mask-image maskImageFilename. If a mask image is specified, denoising is only performed in the mask region.

inputs.name: Input image
inputs.description: -i, --input-image inputImageFilename. A scalar image is expected as input for noise correction.

inputs.name: Corrected image path
inputs.description: The noise corrected version of the input image.

output-files.name: Corrected image
output-files.description: The noise corrected version of the input image.
